config.question: Reagan’s economic systems aimed to strengthen America’s economy largely through the efforts of the __________.

answer_3.response: Reagan embraced the concept of supply-side economics as the remedy for the nation’s economic ills. Supply-side economists believed that the private sector, if encouraged by tax cuts, would shift its resources from tax shelters to productive investment, leading to an economic boom that would provide enough new income to offset the lost revenue.
